conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Point A: Liquid flows downward and to the left, encountering a diagonal baffle directing it further left and downward.
Point B: Liquid flows downward and to the right, encountering a diagonal baffle directing it further right and downward.
Point C: Liquid flows downward and to the left, encountering a diagonal baffle directing it further left and downward.
From A: Liquid moves left and down, passing through the baffle, likely reaching container D.
From B: Liquid moves right and down, passing through the baffle, likely reaching container E.
From C: Liquid moves left and down, similar to A, likely directed towards container D.
Baffles direct flow left or right based on orientation; leftward flow from A and C goes to D, rightward flow from B goes to E.
Container D will receive liquid from points A and C.
Container E will receive liquid from point B.
Final Answer: Liquid from A and C will flow into container D, and liquid from B will flow into container E.
